GoalDesc: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
TargetDesc: Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all
IndicatorDesc: Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health as a share of total household expenditure or income
SeriesDesc: Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health (greater than 10%) as a share of total household expenditure or income (%)

IndicatorDesc: Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health as a share of total household expenditure or income
SeriesDesc: Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health (greater than 10%) as a share of total household expenditure or income (%)

Source: Global database on financial protection http://apps.who.int/gho/cabinet/uhc.jsp and http://www.worldbank.org/en/topic/universalhealthcoverage/publication/tracking-universal-health-coverage-2017-global-monitoring-report; Key indicator of the 2017 global report on Tracking universal health coverage available at  http://www.who.int/healthinfo/universal_health_coverage/report/2017/en/ and http://www.worldbank.org/en/topic/universalhealthcoverage/publication/tracking-universal-health-coverage-2017-global-monitoring-report
Footnotes: [2000]: This regional aggregate is produced by lining-up all countries within an SDG region with estimates available for the period 1995-2005. For a detailed information please refer to the 2017 global report on Tracking universal health coverage available at  http://www.who.int/healthinfo/universal_health_coverage/report/2017/en/ and http://www.worldbank.org/en/topic/universalhealthcoverage/publication/tracking-universal-health-coverage-2017-global-monitoring-report as well as to Wagstaff et al (2018) http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S2214-109X(17)30429-1 // [2005]: This regional aggregate is produced by lining-up all countries within an SDG region with estimates available for the period 2000-2010.
